meanings.definition: Capable of being excited or stimulated.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's excitableness was evident as it wagged its tail at the sight of a ball.
meanings.sent2: She showed her excitableness by jumping up and down when she heard the good news.
meanings.sent3: The excitableness of the squirrel made it chase its own shadow around the tree.
meanings.sent4: His excitableness was like a coiled spring, ready to burst with energy at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The excitableness of the children on the playground was contagious, spreading joy to all around.

meanings.sent1: The excitableness cat leaped at the sudden movement, startled by the noise.
meanings.sent2: His excitableness showed when he blushed at the compliment.
meanings.sent3: The excitableness of the alarm clock made him jump out of bed every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her excitableness was like a firecracker, quick to ignite with the slightest spark.
meanings.sent5: The excitableness of the audience grew as the magician prepared for his final trick.

meanings.definition: The quality of being easily excited or stimulated.
meanings.sent1: The excitableness of the child was evident in his constant giggles and laughter.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't contain her excitableness as she waited for the surprise party to begin.
meanings.sent3: The excitableness of the puppy made it chase its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The excitableness of the crowd was like a wave of energy pulsing through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: His excitableness was like a bright light, drawing others to share in his enthusiasm.
